ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager

Class HttpDataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager.JsonDataManager
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager.HttpDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataManager

    public class HttpDataManager
extends JsonDataManager
    A JsonDataManager that uses the ElasticSearch server as the storage media. Created by rishi on 15-10-30.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpDataManager

        public HttpDataManager(com.path.android.jobqueue.network.NetworkUtil networkUtil,
                       boolean useExplicitExposeAnnotation)
        Creates an instance of HttpDataManager.
        Parameters:
        networkUtil - The NetworkUtil to be used for checking the network state.
        useExplicitExposeAnnotation - True, if the @expose annotations are to be explicitly used, else false. If this is set to true, only the fields with the annotation @expose will be serialized/de-serialized.

      • HttpDataManager

        public HttpDataManager(com.path.android.jobqueue.network.NetworkUtil networkUtil)
        Creates an instance of the HttpDataManager. The manager will set the value of "useExplicitExposeAnnotation" to false.
        Parameters:
        networkUtil - The NetworkUtil to be used for checking the network state.

      • HttpDataManager

        public HttpDataManager()
        Creates an instance of the HttpDataManager. The manager will set the value of "useExplicitExposeAnnotation" to false, and will use ElasticSearchNetworkUtil as the NetworkUtil.

      • HttpDataManager

        public HttpDataManager(boolean useExplicitExposeAnnotation)
        Creates an instance of HttpDataManager. The manager will use ElasticSearchNetworkUtil as the NetworkUtil.
        Parameters:
        useExplicitExposeAnnotation - True, if the @expose annotations are to be explicitly used, else false. If this is set to true, only the fields with the annotation @expose will be serialized/de-serialized.

      • keyExists

        public boolean keyExists(DataKey key)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         ServiceNotAvailableException
        Checks if the DataKey exists in the storage media.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be looked up.
        Returns:
        True, if the key exists, else false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.
        ServiceNotAvailableException

      • getData

        public <T> T getData(DataKey key,
                     java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ServiceNotAvailableException
        Retrieves the data pointed to by the key from the storage media.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object being retrieved. This type should match with the parameter "typeOfT", else a ClassCastException might be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be used for lookup.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object being retrieved.
        Returns:
        The retrieved object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.
        ServiceNotAvailableException

                          java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)

        Write the object to the storage, or overwrites the existing one if one existed.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey for the object.
        obj - The object to be stored.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object.
